description: The Repository & Tooling Interface subsystem provides AI agents with structured, unified access to a project's codebase, version control, static analysis results, and documentation. It acts as an orchestration layer that aggregates specialized tools (Git management, file system access, static analysis, dependency analysis, and documentation processing), exposes their functionality through a central toolkit, and routes queries so agents can retrieve code, metadata, analysis artifacts (like CFGs), and documentation without directly handling low-level I/O or analysis logic.

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit (Orchestration Engine)
components.description: Central facade and orchestration engine that aggregates and exposes specialized tools (Git, file access, static analysis, documentation) to AI agents and coordinates workflows. It serves as the primary entry point for agents to interact with the subsystem.

components.name: Git Repository Manager (Repository Management Layer)
components.description: Handles Git-related operations such as cloning, branch management, commits, and diffs, providing version control system (VCS) interactions for agents.

components.name: File System Access Tool (File System Abstraction Layer)
components.description: Provides an abstracted interface for reading file contents and analyzing directory structures, hiding low-level file I/O from agents. It also handles `.gitignore` rules for selective file access.

components.name: Static Analysis Result Provider (Code & Static Analysis Interface)
components.description: Offers a standardized interface for agents to query pre-computed or on-demand static code analysis results, including code structure, dependencies, and identified issues, without directly invoking the analysis engine.

components.name: Documentation Access Provider (Documentation Reader Interface)
components.description: Facilitates locating and reading documentation files (e.g., Markdown, RST) within the repository, providing a structured way for agents to access project context and information.

components.name: Code & Static Analysis Engine (Core Analysis)
components.description: Performs the actual static analysis on source code, including extracting code references, analyzing code structure (classes, methods), generating Control Flow Graphs (CFG), and identifying method invocations. This is the core processing unit for code insights.

components.name: Dependency & Package Analyzer (Dependency Analysis)
components.description: Identifies and analyzes external dependencies (e.g., package manifests like `package.json`, `requirements.txt`) and internal package/module relationships within the codebase.

components.name: Documentation Reader (Core Documentation Processing)
components.description: Specializes in locating, parsing, and extracting structured information from various documentation file formats within the repository, making the content ready for consumption by the Documentation Access Provider.
